DescribeDBClusterEndpoints.description: The following example retrieves details for your DB cluster endpoints. The most common kinds of Aurora clusters have two endpoints. One endpoint has type WRITER. You can use this endpoint for all SQL statements. The other endpoint has type READER. You can use this endpoint only for SELECT and other read-only SQL statements.
DescribeDBClusterEndpoints.title: To describe DB cluster endpoints

DescribeDBClusterEndpoints.description: The following example retrieves details for the DB cluster endpoints of a single specified DB cluster. Aurora Serverless clusters have only a single endpoint with a type of WRITER.
DescribeDBClusterEndpoints.title: To describe DB cluster endpoints of a single DB cluster

Parameters.Description: Controls whether user-defined functions that have only an xxx symbol for the main function can be loaded

DescribeEventCategories.description: The following example retrieves details about the event categories for all available event sources.

DescribeEventSubscriptions.description: This example describes all of the Amazon RDS event subscriptions for the current AWS account.

DescribeGlobalClusters.description: The following example lists Aurora global DB clusters in the current AWS Region.

DescribeIntegrations.description: The following example retrieves information about a zero-ETL integration with Amazon Redshift.

DescribeOptionGroupOptions.description: The following example lists the options for an RDS for MySQL version 8.0 DB instance.
DescribeOptionGroupOptions.title: To describe all available options

DescribeOptionGroups.description: The following example lists the options groups for an Oracle Database 19c instance.

DescribeOrderableDBInstanceOptions.description: The following example retrieves details about the orderable options for a DB instances running the MySQL DB engine.

DescribePendingMaintenanceActions.description: The following example lists the pending maintenace action for a DB instance.

DescribeReservedDBInstances.description: The following example retrieves details about any reserved DB instances in the current AWS account.

DescribeReservedDBInstancesOfferings.description: The following example retrieves details about reserved DB instance options for RDS for Oracle.
DescribeReservedDBInstancesOfferings.title: To describe reserved DB instance offerings

DescribeSourceRegions.description: The following example retrieves details about all source AWS Regions where the current AWS Region can create a read replica, copy a DB snapshot from, or replicate automated backups from. It also shows that automated backups can be replicated only from US West (Oregon) to the destination AWS Region, US East (N. Virginia).
DescribeSourceRegions.title: To describe source Regions

DescribeValidDBInstanceModifications.description: The following example retrieves details about the valid modifications for the specified DB instance.
DescribeValidDBInstanceModifications.title: To describe valid modifications for a DB instance

DownloadDBLogFilePortion.description: The following example downloads only the latest part of your log file.
DownloadDBLogFilePortion.title: To download a DB log file

FailoverDBCluster.description: This example performs a failover for the specified DB cluster to the specified DB instance.
FailoverDBCluster.title: To perform a failover for a DB cluster

ListTagsForResource.description: The following example lists all tags on a DB instance.
ListTagsForResource.title: To list tags on an Amazon RDS resource

ModifyCertificates.description: The following example temporarily overrides the system-default SSL/TLS certificate for new DB instances.
ModifyCertificates.title: To temporarily override the system-default SSL/TLS certificate for new DB instances

ModifyCurrentDBClusterCapacity.description: The following example scales the capacity of an Aurora Serverless DB cluster to 8.
ModifyCurrentDBClusterCapacity.title: To scale the capacity of an Aurora Serverless DB cluster

ModifyDBCluster.description: The following example changes the master user password for the DB cluster named cluster-2 and sets the backup retention period to 14 days. The ApplyImmediately parameter causes the changes to be made immediately, instead of waiting until the next maintenance window.
ModifyDBCluster.title: To modify a DB cluster

ModifyDBClusterEndpoint.description: The following example modifies the specified custom DB cluster endpoint.
ModifyDBClusterEndpoint.title: To modify a custom DB cluster endpoint

ModifyDBClusterParameterGroup.description: The following example modifies the values of parameters in a DB cluster parameter group.
ModifyDBClusterParameterGroup.title: To modify parameters in a DB cluster parameter group

ModifyDBClusterSnapshotAttribute.description: The following example makes changes to the specified DB cluster snapshot attribute.
ModifyDBClusterSnapshotAttribute.title: To modify a DB cluster snapshot attribute

ModifyDBInstance.description: The following example associates an option group and a parameter group with a compatible Microsoft SQL Server DB instance. The ApplyImmediately parameter causes the option and parameter groups to be associated immediately, instead of waiting until the next maintenance window.
ModifyDBInstance.title: To modify a DB instance

ModifyDBParameterGroup.description: The following example changes the value of the clr enabled parameter in a DB parameter group. The value of the ApplyMethod parameter causes the DB parameter group to be modified immediately, instead of waiting until the next maintenance window.
ModifyDBParameterGroup.title: To modify a DB parameter group

ModifyDBSnapshot.description: The following example upgrades a PostgeSQL 10.6 snapshot named db5-snapshot-upg-test to PostgreSQL 11.7. The new DB engine version is shown after the snapshot has finished upgrading and its status is available.
ModifyDBSnapshot.title: To modify a DB snapshot

ModifyDBSnapshotAttribute.description: The following example grants permission to two AWS accounts, with the identifiers 111122223333 and 444455556666, to restore the DB snapshot named mydbsnapshot.
ModifyDBSnapshotAttribute.title: To allow two AWS accounts to restore a DB snapshot

ModifyDBSnapshotAttribute.description: The following example removes permission from the AWS account with the identifier 444455556666 to restore the DB snapshot named mydbsnapshot.
ModifyDBSnapshotAttribute.title: To prevent an AWS account from restoring a DB snapshot

ModifyDBSubnetGroup.description: The following example adds a subnet with the ID subnet-08e41f9e230222222 to the DB subnet group named mysubnetgroup. To keep the existing subnets in the subnet group, include their IDs as values in the --subnet-ids option. Make sure to have subnets with at least two different Availability Zones in the DB subnet group.
ModifyDBSubnetGroup.title: To modify a DB subnet group

ModifyEventSubscription.description: The following example turns off the specified event subscription, so that it no longer publishes notifications to the specified Amazon Simple Notification Service topic.
ModifyEventSubscription.title: To modify an event subscription

ModifyGlobalCluster.description: The following example enables deletion protection for an Aurora MySQL-based global database cluster.
ModifyGlobalCluster.title: To modify a global database cluster

ModifyIntegration.description: The following example modifies the name of an existing zero-ETL integration.
ModifyIntegration.title: To modify a zero-ETL integration

ModifyOptionGroup.description: The following example adds an option to an option group.
ModifyOptionGroup.title: To modify an option group

PromoteReadReplica.description: The following example promotes the specified read replica to become a standalone DB instance.
PromoteReadReplica.title: To promote a read replica

PurchaseReservedDBInstancesOffering.description: The following example shows how to buy the reserved DB instance offering from the previous example.
PurchaseReservedDBInstancesOffering.title: To purchase a reserved DB instance

RebootDBInstance.description: The following example starts a reboot of the specified DB instance.
RebootDBInstance.title: To reboot a DB instance

RemoveFromGlobalCluster.description: The following example detaches an Aurora secondary cluster from an Aurora global database cluster. The cluster changes from being read-only to a standalone cluster with read-write capability.
RemoveFromGlobalCluster.title: To detach an Aurora secondary cluster from an Aurora global database cluster

RemoveRoleFromDBCluster.description: The following example removes a role from a DB cluster.
RemoveRoleFromDBCluster.title: To disassociate an Identity and Access Management (IAM) role from a DB cluster

RemoveSourceIdentifierFromSubscription.description: The following example removes the specified source identifier from an existing subscription.
RemoveSourceIdentifierFromSubscription.title: To remove a source identifier from a subscription

RemoveTagsFromResource.description: The following example removes tags from a resource.
RemoveTagsFromResource.title: To remove tags from a resource

ResetDBClusterParameterGroup.description: The following example resets all parameter values in a customer-created DB cluster parameter group to their default values.
ResetDBClusterParameterGroup.title: To reset all parameters to their default values

ResetDBParameterGroup.description: The following example resets all parameter values in a customer-created DB parameter group to their default values.
ResetDBParameterGroup.title: To reset all parameters to their default values

RestoreDBClusterFromS3.description: The following example restores an Amazon Aurora MySQL version 5.7-compatible DB cluster from a MySQL 5.7 DB backup file in Amazon S3.
RestoreDBClusterFromS3.title: To restore an Amazon Aurora DB cluster from Amazon S3

RestoreDBClusterFromSnapshot.description: The following example restores an Aurora PostgreSQL DB cluster compatible with PostgreSQL version 10.7 from a DB cluster snapshot named test-instance-snapshot.
RestoreDBClusterFromSnapshot.title: To restore a DB cluster from a snapshot

RestoreDBClusterToPointInTime.description: The following example restores the DB cluster named database-4 to the latest possible time. Using copy-on-write as the restore type restores the new DB cluster as a clone of the source DB cluster.
RestoreDBClusterToPointInTime.title: To restore a DB cluster to a specified time

RestoreDBInstanceFromDBSnapshot.description: The following example creates a new DB instance named db7-new-instance with the db.t3.small DB instance class from the specified DB snapshot. The source DB instance from which the snapshot was taken uses a deprecated DB instance class, so you can't upgrade it.
RestoreDBInstanceFromDBSnapshot.title: To restore a DB instance from a DB snapshot

RestoreDBInstanceToPointInTime.description: The following example restores test-instance to a new DB instance named restored-test-instance, as of the specified time.
RestoreDBInstanceToPointInTime.title: To restore a DB instance to a point in time

RevokeDBSecurityGroupIngress.description: This example revokes ingress for the specified CIDR block associated with the specified DB security group.
RevokeDBSecurityGroupIngress.title: To revoke ingress for a DB security group

StartActivityStream.description: The following example starts an asynchronous activity stream to monitor an Aurora cluster named my-pg-cluster.
StartActivityStream.title: To start a database activity stream

StartDBCluster.description: The following example starts a DB cluster and its DB instances.
StartDBCluster.title: To start a DB cluster

StartDBInstance.description: The following example starts the specified DB instance.
StartDBInstance.title: To start a DB instance

StartDBInstanceAutomatedBackupsReplicati.description: The following example replicates automated backups from a DB instance in the US East (N. Virginia) Region. The backup retention period is 14 days.
StartDBInstanceAutomatedBackupsReplicati.title: To enable cross-Region automated backups

StartExportTask.description: The following example exports a DB snapshot named db5-snapshot-test to the Amazon S3 bucket named mybucket.
StartExportTask.title: To export a snapshot to Amazon S3

StopActivityStream.description: The following example stops an activity stream in an Aurora cluster named my-pg-cluster.
StopActivityStream.title: To stop a database activity stream

StopDBCluster.description: The following example stops a DB cluster and its DB instances.
StopDBCluster.title: To stop a DB cluster

StopDBInstance.description: The following example stops the specified DB instance.
StopDBInstance.title: To stop a DB instance

StopDBInstanceAutomatedBackupsReplicatio.description: The following example ends replication of automated backups. Replicated backups are retained according to the set backup retention period.
StopDBInstanceAutomatedBackupsReplicatio.title: To stop replicating automated backups

SwitchoverBlueGreenDeployment.description: The following example promotes the specified green environment as the new production environment.
SwitchoverBlueGreenDeployment.title: To switch a blue/green deployment for an RDS DB instance

SwitchoverBlueGreenDeployment.description: The following example promotes the specified green environment as the new production environment.
SwitchoverBlueGreenDeployment.title: To promote a blue/green deployment for an Aurora MySQL DB cluster
